result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary M Lobotzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No (violent) contact with:  E.K.

Domestic Violence Counseling through a State-certified batterer's intervention program with an Anger Management component.

Completion of a Parenting class.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary M Lobotzke

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:46 AM Defendant Zachary M Lobotzke in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant would like to resolve the case.
There is no pre-trial offer in the file at this time. 
Defendant to reach out to public defender for an offer. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Witness A/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:55 AM Defendant Zachary M Lobotzke in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 05/25/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
